description.narrative: The project identifies strategic areas of intervention to assist institutional mechanisms for inclusive, effective, and accountable service delivery for rights based approach to development

participating-org.narrative: SWISS AGENCY FOR DEVELOPMENT AND COOPERATION - SDC
UNDP AS ADMINISTRATIVE AGENT FOR A JOINT PROGRAMME PASS THROUGH ARRANGEMENT
UNITED STATES AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT (USAID)

activity-description.narrative: At the Federal Level the project supports the Ministry of IPC & Ministry of HR to establish strong institutional mechanisms

At the district level in Swat, the project works with the District Council to establish integration support groups led by youth councilors to support communities in resilience building efforts in a post conflict scenario.
At the provincial level in Balochistan, the project collaborated with Human Rights Departments to support them in rights development strategies.
At the provincial level in KPK, the project collaborated with Law, Parliamentary Affairs & Human Rights Departments to provide technical assistance in ensuring a rights enabling environment.

description.narrative: seat of a first-order administrative division

activity-description.narrative: At the provincial level in Punjab, the project collaborated with Human Rights Departments to support them in rights development strategies.
At the provincial level in Sindh, the project collaborated with Human Rights Departments to support them in rights development strategies.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Language updated after Pro-Doc Revision in 2019
1.1: Extent to which federal institutions develop and effectively implement gender sensitive and inclusive policies/regulations ensuring protection and promotion of human rights. Scale: 1: Policies/regulations partially developed. 2: Policies/regulations developed but not implemented. 3: Policies/regulations developed and partially implemented
1.2: Extent to which technical capacity of federal institutions is enhanced to enable duty-bearers to effectively deliver on their respective mandates, particularly for women and youth empowerment Scale: (1: Very Basic Capacity 2: Partial Capacity 3: Capacity Largely in Place)
2.1: Existence of strengthened institutions and systems supporting fulfilment of nationally and internationally ratified human rights obligations: a) Rule of law and justice b) human rights Scale 1: Policies/regulations partially developed. 2: Policies/regulations developed but not implemented. 3: Policies/regulations developed and partially implemented
2.2: Technical capacity of provincial institutions on human rights and local governance is enhanced Scale:1: Very Basic Capacity 2: Partial Capacity 3: Capacity Largely in Place
3.1: Extent to which LGs are capacitated for provision of inclusive (particularly women) service delivery. Scale: 1: Very Partial Capacity 2: Partial capacity 3: Capacity Largely in Place
4.1: Extent to which citizens oversight enables improved sectoral government action 1: Limited Capacity 2: Very Partial Capacity 3: Partial capacity 4. Capacity largely exist

comment.narrative: 1.1: Scale 1 (No capacity) 1.2: Scale item 1: Very Basic Capacity 2.1: Scale 1 (No capacity) (Technical support provided to KP Law Dept. workshops & trainings on HR protection mechanisms) 3.1: Scale 1 (No capacity) (Cells established in KP only but LGs not operationalized) 4.1: Scale 1 (Not at all)

1.1: Scale item 2: Policies/regulations developed but not implemented (National Action Plan on business & Human Rights developed and implementation initiated; NCHR work plan developed & 25% recommendations implemented) 1.2: Scale item 2: Partial Capacity(Human Rights Information Management System operationalized; Inter-Provincial Working Group operationalized) 2.1: Scale Item 2: Policies/regulations developed but not implemented (Support for development/implementation of provinci al LG and HR policies/plans) 2.2: Scale Item 1: Very Basic Capacity(Provincial data systems developed in all four provinces; staff trained on data entry and reporting; LG staff trained on inclusive service delivery in KP and Balochistan) 3.1: Scale Item 2: Partial capacity (Institutional digitization programme for inclusive, transparent and accountable service delivery designed for target district in all four provinces; Psycho social support and economic empowerment programme rolled out for 3000 (50% women) vulnerable and at-risk youth in all four provinces 4.1: Scale Item 2: Very Partial Capacity(Integration Support Groups (ISGs) assisting Social Welfare Departments in 3 target districts each in Sindh, KP and Punjab; partially improved engagement between CSOs and government for improved access to services of the most vulnerable and at-risk populations (particularly women, transgenders and youth)

1.1: Scale item 2: Policies/regulations developed but not implemented-Nationwide consultations conducted with government, civil society and private sector stakeholders for development of draft National Action Plan; continued support provided to NCHR to implement 25% recommendations as per 2 year work plan. 1.2: Scale item 2: Partial Capacity-HRIMS servers installed in all four provinces; linkages established with federal HRIMS 2.1: Scale Item 2: Yes, Support provided to HR, LG and Social Welfare departments; however delays due to COVID-19 in implementation of provincial plans. 2.2: Scale Item 1: Very Basic Capacity development exercises conducted in KP for HRIMS staff; LG and SWD staff training on inclusive service delivery (twinning) and gender-based planning and budgeting 3.1:Scale Item 2: Partial capacity- COVID-19 task established to develop a road-map for inclusive local governance in line with the UN’s soc-economic assessment; psycho-social support and economic empowerment programme implemented in Swat and Multan; gender desks established in NMAs, Swat, Multan and Karachi 4.1:Scale Item 2: Very Partial Capacity: ISGs established and linked with local administration for increased awareness and oversight of development initiatives; helplines for psycho-social support to vulnerable and at-risk populations established in partnership with local government and civil society actors

1.1: Scale item 3: Policies/regulations developed and partially implemented (National Action Plan approved by competent authority and implementation of short-term recommendations initiated; support provided to NHRIs, including NCHR, NCRC, NCSW; technical assistance provided to implement policies targeting vulnerable groups, particularly persons with disabilities) 1.2: Scale item 2: Partial Capacity(Human Rights Information Management System operationalized; Inter-Provincial Working Group operationalized) 2.1: Scale Item 2: Policies/regulations developed but not implemented (Support provided for development/implementation of provincial LG and HR policies/plans) 2.2: Scale Item 2: Partial Capacity (Provincial HRIMS stakeholders provided capacity development support; Social inclusion and social protection measures (helplines, shelter homes, referral mechanisms) established in all four provinces; institutionalization of protection measures in partnership with LG and SW Departments) 3.1: Scale Item 2: Partial capacity (Implementation of short-term recommendations of the socioeconomic assessment and COVID-19 task-force recommendations; programme on gender-justice and inclusion of persons with disabilities, and transgenders rolled-out; community stabilization programme implemented in Balochistan and discussions with government stakeholders on institutional of the model at the local level initiated) 4.1: Scale Item 2: Very Partial Capacity(Integration Support Groups (ISGs) assisting Social Welfare Departments in 3 target districts each in Sindh, KP and Punjab; partially improved engagement between CSOs and government for improved access to services of the most vulnerable and at-risk populations (particularly women, transgenders and youth)

1.1: Scale item 2: Policies/regulations developed but not implemented-Nationwide consultations conducted with government, civil society and private sector stakeholders- draft National Action plan developed and launched; continued support provided to NCHR to implement 25% recommendations as per 2 year work plan. 1.2: Scale item 2: Partial Capacity-HRIMS servers installed in all four provinces; linkages established with federal HRIMS. Inter-provincial working group on human rights established 2.1: Scale Item 2: Yes, Support provided to HR, LG and Social Welfare Departments; however, delays due to COVID-19 in implementation of provincial plans. 2.2: Scale Item 1: Very Basic Capacity development exercises conducted in Sindh, Balochistan, Punjab and KP for HRIMS staff; LG and SWD staff training on inclusive service delivery (twinning) and gender-based planning and budgeting. Transgender centre established in Islamabad. 3.1: Scale Item 2: Partial capacity- COVID-19 taskforce initiated implementation for inclusive response to Covid-19 in line with the UN’s soc-economic assessment; psycho-social support and economic empowerment programme implemented in Swat and Multan; gender desks established in NMAs, Swat, Multan and Karachi 4.1: Scale Item 2: Very Partial Capacity: ISGs established and linked with local administration for increased awareness and oversight of development initiatives; helplines for psycho-social support to vulnerable and at-risk populations established in partnership with local government and civil society actors; implementation of LLDR model initiated in Quetta

1.1: Scale 2 (Very partial capacity [Technical Assessments conducted for NCHR and MOHR; Rules of Business approved; Implementation on APF Report recommendations initiated]) 2.1: Scale 3 (Partial Capacity) (HR policy development, trainings & technical assistance to provincial departments, MIS support, technical assistance to NHRIs, policy recommendations to ensure vulnerable and at-risk populations have access to fundamental rights; conduct two IPMs) 3.1: Scale 3 (to some extent) (ISGs linked with and registered with district administration; 240 youth provided psycho social support) 3.2: Scale 3 (Partial Capacity) (Continued coordination and capacity building of LG department and district administration; establishment and operationalization of integration cell; increased women empowerment and gender mainstreaming in target districts; innovative twinning between tribal and neighbouring districts in KP) 4.1: Scale 2 (to a very partial extent) (ISGs established in 2018 are formalized and linked with local authorities; Provincial Civil Society Engagement Platforms established; Communications outreach strategy launched)

Indicator 1.1: UNDP Pakistan provided support to the NCHR to prepare a two-year work plan for implementation of Asia Pacific Foundation (APF) recommendations; 2 key recommendations on institutional capacity were implemented. Furthermore, UNDP provided technical assistance to the MoHR for development of a digital data collection, analysis and reporting system, the Human Rights Information Management System; initiated the baseline assessment on Business and Human Rights and prepared the draft list of human rights indicators to embed in the HRIMS.
Indicator 2.1: UNDP continued collaborations with the provincial human rights information management systems to localize the national human rights indicators for realistic and effective data capture at the sub-national level; furthermore, UNDP organised two inter-provincial coordination meetings to encourage inclusive access to services, particularly for vulnerable populations
Indicator 3.1 The project implemented a comprehensive community stabilization programme in Karachi, Swat and Multan; the project focused on provision of psycho-social support, livelihood skills trainings and community awareness and sensitization events for 150 young men and 150 young women. Integrated support groups comprising influential and notable community members were established to ensure a whole of community implementation approach to counter extremist tendencies in target areas.
Indicator 3.2: UNDP established 7 gender desks in the newly merged districts of KP to increase access to basic services for women. Furthermore, UNDP continued provision of technical capacity building to local government and social welfare officials in the newly merged areas by linking them and from leveraging expertise of government officials in the settled districts of KP, through the innovative concept of “twinning”
Indicator 4.1: The ISGs established in 2018 were continued provided support and were linked with the Local Government in Karachi; this also resulted in the formation and operationalization of a gender desk at within the LG office in Karachi District West; Furthermore, communications and outreach events were conducted across KP and Sindh to bridge the gap between rights holders and duty bearers, particularly with regards to protection and promotion of human rights and access to basic services.

1.1 (scale item 3) Policies/regulations developed and partially implemented Implementation of National Action Plan recommendations initiated; support provided to NHRIs, including NCHR, NCRC, NCSW; technical assistance provided to implement policies targeting vulnerable groups, particularly persons with disabilities 1.2Scale item 2: Partial Capacity (Capacity development of federal government stakeholders to implement a rights-based approach to development) 2.1: Scale Item 2: Policies/regulations developed but not implemented (Support provided for implementation of provincial SWD, LG and HR policies/plans) 2.2:Scale Item 2: Partial Capacity(Provincial HRIMS stakeholders provided capacity development support; Social inclusion and social protection measures (helplines, shelter homes, referral mechanisms continued in all four provinces; institutionalization of protection measures in partnership with Women Development and Social Welfare Departments 3.1:Scale Item 2: Partial capacity Implementation of short-term recommendations of the socio-economic assessment and COVID-19 task-force recommendations; programme on gender-justice and inclusion of persons with disabilities, and transgenders implemented; community stabilization programme implemented in Balochistan and discussions with government stakeholders on institutional of the model at the local level finalized 4.1:Scale Item 2: Very Partial Capacity (Integration Support Groups (ISGs) assisting Social Welfare and Women Development Department in Quetta partially improved engagement between CSOs and government for improved access to services of the most vulnerable and at-risk populations (particularly women, transgenders and youth)
